title: Solutions Architect
content:
At Qualtrics, we create software that the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform. We are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18,000 clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and an appreciation for the unconventional—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers. When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set ambitious goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged, and complex problems are solved by collaborating and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities— they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.
Why We have this Role: 
We are seeking a Solutions Architect to join our team to help drive business growth and expansion in the ANZ region. 
As a Solutions Architect you will combine your business acumen and deep technical, hands-on experience to help large enterprises leverage the power of the Qualtrics platform and transform their business. In this role, you will work with business and technical decision makers from our largest accounts, as well as Qualtrics’ technology partners and account teams.
Solutions Architects engage early in the project lifecycle where the customer is just beginning to define the vision, and often lean on the Solutions Architect to imagine what is possible and determine if it’s feasible.   The role requires an affinity for solution selling, technology evangelism and customer engagement. The ability to win the hearts and minds of our customers while explaining abstract technical concepts in a non-technical manner as they relate to business value, is a must.
How You'll Find Success: 
To excel in this role, you will need to demonstrate a strong blend of technical expertise, business acumen, and stellar relationship-building skills. Building strong relationships with our customers' key decision-makers and understanding their business requirements will be crucial to guide the design and implementation of solutions that drive measurable business outcomes. Success will be measured by your ability to operate regularly in ambiguous situations and discover opportunities. As the solution is defined, you will construct a system that is profitably replicable and then move on the next situation. This role requires a high degree of cross-functional collaboration with Sales, Engineering, and customers.
You will also continually expand and deepen your knowledge of emerging technologies and incorporate them into your solutions.
How You'll Grow:
This role offers immense opportunities for professional growth. As a Solutions Architect, you will have the chance to work with industry-leading technologies and be at the forefront of cutting-edge solutions. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse and talented team and participate in cross-functional projects that span different industries and geographies. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the product roadmap and shape the future of our solutions, further enhancing your skills and expertise.
Things You'll Do:

Lead project discovery and design sessions, including project scoping to ensure alignment between the customer's needs and Qualtrics services/ solutions.
Validate and articulate business impact of the solution to key technical and business decision-makers at customer organizations. 
Design customized and compelling technical solutions that align with customers' business objectives, especially at the Enterprise level.
Collaborate closely with sales, delivery, engineering and other teams to deliver strong outcomes.
Stay up to date with industry trends and provide insights and recommendations to drive innovation.
Take ownership of opportunities, manage multiple projects, and adapt to changes in a fast-paced environment.
Maintain technical excellence through continuous learning and adoption of emerging technologies.

What We're Looking for on Your Resume:

3-8 years of experience in a pre-sales environment, shaping complex technology solutions.
Bachelor's or equivalent degree. Majors in a technical discipline are valued.
Strong solution design experience or experience implementing custom solutions for enterprise customers.
Deep understanding of cloud computing technologies, emerging trends, and their business implications.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience in software design, application design, systems operations/management, database architecture, IP networking, storage, or IT security.

What You Should Know about this Team: 
Our team is a dynamic and collaborative group of professionals who are passionate about delivering innovative solutions to our customers. We value creativity, teamwork, and a customer-centric approach. We believe in challenging the status quo and continuously pushing the boundaries of what is possible. Together, we work towards the common goal of driving customer success and helping organizations transform their businesses through the power of technology.
Our Team's Favorite Perks and Benefits:

A comprehensive package consisting of base, bonus, and generous benefits. Clear expectations for performance and progression pathways.
Private health insurance - top of the range coverage.
Annual Experience Bonus - we want to facilitate some great experiences for our employees. Put this bonus towards an experience you’ve always wanted to have!
Experience Leave - additional 5 days a year to take for experiences!
Quarterly Wellness Stipend - reimburse your physical and mental wellbeing costs.
Commuter allowance - we take care of your public transport expenses to the office!
Catered lunches in our North Sydney office - 5 days a week.

demographic_questions.description:
DEI (Diversity, Equity and Inclusion) is a cornerstone of our company culture. With strong views on diversity and inclusion, immigration, wage equality, and the universality of human rights—without regard to race, color, creed, gender, or sexual orientation— we will not be quiet but will amplify these views on behalf of our employees and organization.

With this in mind, we invite you to participate in the following set of voluntary demographic questions. The data collected will be used anonymously and in aggregate, so we can evaluate our processes to ensure we're providing equal opportunities to applicants from all backgrounds. Your responses, or your choice not to respond, will not be associated with your specific application and will not in any way be used for individual hiring or compensation decisions.

questions.label: How would you describe your racial/ethnic background? (mark all that apply)

answer_options.label: Aboriginal Australian or Torres Strait Islander
Hispanic, Latinx or of Spanish Origin

questions.label: How would you describe your gender identity? (mark all that apply)
Where have you seen Qualtrics prior to applying? Select all that apply.

values.label: I am a member of the Qualtrics Talent Community
I learned about Qualtrics from a current employee (social networking, referral, word of mouth)
I attended a networking event or career fair
I have seen Qualtrics on social media (LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, etc)
I found Qualtrics through a third-party career site (Indeed, Glassdoor, University website, niche networking site, etc)
I have read content created by Qualtrics
I have used the Qualtrics product suite
I googled jobs and a Qualtrics role was suggested
I am a current Qualtrics employee

questions.label: Are you of legal age to work in the country in which this position is based?
Are you legally authorized to work in the country in which this position is located?
Do you now or will you in the future require Qualtrics to sponsor your employment in the country in which this position is located?
Are you willing to undergo a background check as part of this hiring process?
Have you ever worked at Qualtrics in the following capacities? (check all that apply):

values.label: I have not worked for Qualtrics in the past

questions.label: Are you related to a current employee of Qualtrics? If yes, please specify name and relationship. A "relative" is defined as one of the following: spouse or significant other, parent/step parent, child/step child, grandparent, grandchild, brother, sister, uncle, aunt, nephew, niece, first cousin, in-laws (mother, father, sister, brother, daughter, son).
